description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c0vgv","text":"Public health laboratories are encouraged to submit sequencing data for SARS-CoV-2 to multiple public data repositories to ensure broad access by the research community and public health institutions for rapid, genomics-driven public health response to disease outbreaks. There are three primary public repositories for depositing SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dlm2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a17vb","text":"Global initiative on sharing all influenza data (GISAID) EpiCov,","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8umj5","text":"National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) GenBank, and ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"frofd","text":"NCBI SRA (sequence read archive).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpiem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12j49","text":"Laboratories are encouraged to submit consensus assemblies to both GISAID and GenBank, as well as submit raw (filtered) sequencing reads to NCBI SRA. NCBI is a division of the National Library of Medicine within the US government's National Institutes of Health and organizes a breadth of biomedical resources including publicly accessible genome sequences, annotations, analyses, and derived data. GISAID was created as a framework for openly sharing influenza (and now SARS-CoV-2) sequence data, while maintaining strict governance over the data use and attribution to sequence submitters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":150,"length":4},{"key":1,"offset":399,"length":6}],"data":[]},{"key":"b765v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e9kjf","text":"The Mercury workflows are designed to aid submission to public repositories as explained in Theiagen's YouTube series:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fscn8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7g2ut","text":"Mercury Overview:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h8YASVckOrw","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":19,"length":43}],"data":[]},{"key":"6mgp8","text":"Mercury Tutorial Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFJT_QEk25s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":25,"length":43}],"data":[]},{"key":"7khi4","text":"Mercury Tutorial Part 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mtBXbbT3vPg","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":25,"length":43}],"data":[]},{"key":"bpnag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"acocq","text":"Titan Mercury Workflows: This workflow will take in reads, consensus sequence assemblies, and sample metadata and package all of those inputs into repository submittable files for submission to GISAID and GenBank (SRA coming soon). This protocol first starts with preparing SE (single-end) or PE (paired-end) reads for submission and then moves to prepare all the samples into a batch for bulk submission as you likely have many samples to submit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4to12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eriqs","text":"Mercury SE/PE Prep - prepares assembly and sample metadata files for samples individually from either single-end or paired-end sequencing runs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7hhva","text":" Will only generate prepped files for assemblies with \u003c5,000 Ns","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3aopj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"efjur","text":"Mercury Batch -  concatenates assemblies (fasta files) and combines metadata sheets for batch submissions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jcq8","text":"Will only batch samples with 0 VADR alerts","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bcli8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bheq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4oc6l","text":"For technical assistance, please contact: TOAST@cdc.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ak6nr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BD4EDA5BB8C711EB91440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BD4EDB7FB8C711EB91440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.gisaid.org"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7F95BBEA2DF011EC9FDA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h8YASVckOrw"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7BE9B893B80B11EB9DCC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFJT_QEk25s"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7BE9B8DDB80B11EB9DCC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mtBXbbT3vPg"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"413o4","text":"Importing the Mercury Workflow from Dockstore to the User Workspace","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ce2o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"frors","text":"We will first walk through steps to import the Mercury workflow, and at the end there is a video showing the full process. You should already have a workspace created from when you ran the Titan workflow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dqi33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4e5vb","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75ft9","text":"The script for the Titan workflow is located in the Dockstore repository and has to be imported into the user Terra Workspace. There are two ways to get to the Workspace page. The first method starts by clicking on the three parallel lines in the top left-hand corner, followed by clicking the 'Library' tab, and finally click the 'Workflows' button.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"59vcs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8cv5p","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5khn9","text":"In the 'Workflows' panel, under 'Find Additional Workflows' click on the 'Dockstore' link","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"es99m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4a9gh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"45nh9","text":"Alternatively, from within your workspace click on the \"Workflows\" tab, then click on the blue \"+\" inside the \"Find a workflow\" panel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eo1bf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4asv2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5bt49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"446h3","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8824j","text":"On the left side of the Dockstore page, enter 'theiagen/public_health_viral_genomics/' in the search bar. There are three Mercury workflows to choose from:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bfm19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7h389","text":"Mercury_PE_Prep - preparing sequences from paired-end sequencing runs","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5qmnt","text":"Mercury_SE_Prep - preparing sequences from single-end sequencing runs","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"br0ev","text":"Mercury_Batch - combining sequences and metadata from multiple samples for submission ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"crufo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7sntb","text":"Select either PE or SE based on your situation. The examples below assume that you have several samples to prep using the Mercury_PE_Prep workflow. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":122,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":147,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6mdi6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4o8rc","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4g6es","text":"Click the 'theiagen/public_health_viral_genomics/Mercury_PE_Prep' link, which will take you to a new page. A basic data BioProject holds actual sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. BioProjects provide a framework for large-scale research efforts to connect submissions of various types (genome, transcriptome, etc.) and to various data repositories. (BioProject example: PRJNA706724).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":627,"length":11}],"data":[]},{"key":"4eedu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"894du","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fa9rt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"br3av","text":"State, Country, Continent, Originating Lab and Originating Lab address are all information about the location of          where the sample was taken from.
